oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Spoken tutorials
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: MOUDGALYA, KM
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: screen capture
free and open source software
latex
participative learning
collaborative work
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Spoken tutorials are a technique to create powerful documentation on software packages. This approach is especially useful for free or open source software. It is explained through the development of several spoken tutorials on LaTeX. The main advantage of this method is that no special infrastructure is required and hence it lends to collaborative document development.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: 2009 INTERNATIONAL WORKSHOP ON TECHNOLOGY FOR EDUCATION (T4E 2009),17-23
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: 2nd International Workshop on Technology for Education (T4E 2009),Bangalore, INDIA,AUG 04-06, 2009
